SEARCH
Module org.taskmanager.taskmanager
Package org.taskmanager.taskmanager.controller

Class MediaLabController

java.lang.Object
org.taskmanager.taskmanager.controller.MediaLabController
public class MediaLabController extends Object
This class controls the MediaLab Assistant window. It has an initialize method to initialize the controller. It also has 6 methods for opening other windows, for notifications that need to be displayed, for delayed tasks that need to be shown, and for the buttons that open the task, category and priority management windows respectively, as well as for the search window. Additionally to these, it includes 4 methods for updating the tables and the other windows, but also 1 method for when the window closes in order to close all windows of the application that may be open.

    The constructor of the MediaLabController which is never used or called.

    This method makes sure that when we close the application all open windows are closed, but it also calls the saveAll() methods from the repositories to update the JSON files.

    This method is used to update properly the tables in MediaLabAssistant, but to also update tasks and priorities in the task management window.

  • Constructor Details

    • MediaLabController

      public MediaLabController()
      The constructor of the MediaLabController which is never used or called.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This method is used to initialize properly the controller and the window. It creates properly all the cells of the task and notification table. Then it checks whether there are notifications and delayed tasks to be displayed and calls the windows for what exists. Finally, we update the MediaLab Assistant tables at the end to make sure it is updated with the current state.

    • notificationDisplay

      public void notificationDisplay()
      This method loads the NotificationDisplay FXML file, its controller, initializes it with the repositories and shows it.

    • goToTasksWindow

      public void goToTasksWindow()
      This method loads the TaskManager FXML file, its controller, initializes it with the repositories and the MediaLabController, and shows it.

    • goToCategoriesWindow

      public void goToCategoriesWindow()
      This method loads the CategoryManagement FXML file, its controller, initializes it with the repositories and the MediaLabController, and shows it.

    • goToPrioritiesWindow

      public void goToPrioritiesWindow()
      This method loads the PriorityManagement FXML file, its controller, initializes it with the repositories and the MediaLabController, and shows it.

    • updateMediaLabTables

      public void updateMediaLabTables()
      This method is used to update properly the tables in MediaLabAssistant, but to also update tasks and priorities in the task management window. Finally, it also updates the summary. Not all updates need to happen all the time, but it was considered more efficient to update the whole application with each change.

    • onClose

      public void onClose(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      This method makes sure that when we close the application all open windows are closed, but it also calls the saveAll() methods from the repositories to update the JSON files.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The MediaLab Controller stage.
